abstract: As the California attorney general’s office dropped charges against Hewlett-Packard‘s former chairwoman, Patricia C. Dunn, and accepted guilty pleas from three other defendants over a spying scandal, pundits are speculating over the reasons why. The most common refrain: The laws at the time did not warrant Ms. Dunn’s conviction.
lead_paragraph: As the California attorney general’s office dropped charges against Hewlett-Packard‘s former chairwoman, Patricia C. Dunn, and accepted guilty pleas from three other defendants over a spying scandal, pundits are speculating over the reasons why. The most common refrain: The laws at the time did not warrant Ms. Dunn’s conviction.

headline.main: Why California’s Hewlett-Packard Case Fell Apart
